title: Multidimensional network
summary: In network theory, multidimensional networks, a special type of multilayer network, are networks with multiple kinds of relations.[1][2][3][4][5][6] Increasingly sophisticated attempts to model real-world systems as multidimensional networks have yielded valuable insight in the fields of social network analysis,[2][3][7][8][9][10][11] economics, urban and international transport,[12][13][14] ecology,[15][16][17][18] psychology,[19][20] medicine, biology,[21] commerce, climatology, physics,[22] computational neuroscience,[23][24][25][26] operations management, and finance.
